creator: amar.hussain@mail.com
text:
Using the Demonstration Applet http://jakarta.apache.org/oro/demo.html

If you:

1: choose Glob Expression
2: Then in the first text area exter text "input*"
3: choose contains()
4: Then in the Search Input text area exter text: 

someAAAinput
someBBBinput

The search results is:

Compiling regular expression.

Searching

Match 1: input
Match 2: input

The input contained 2 matches.

This seems like a bug to me.

creator: dfs@apache.org
text: To obtain the behavior you desire call Perl5Matcher.setMultiline with an argument of true prior to performing your matches.  If you don't know how to use the software, please post a question to the oro-user mailing list first before opening a bug report.
